channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pot of rubbish still remains, 13th December
item.description:
Thank you for coming to take the rubbish away however some rubbish has been left there that fell out the bag. Do the cleaners not also clean that when they collect the rubbish.?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging branch is dangerous, 13th December
item.description:
This has already been reported (on Wednesday 10th Dec) under reference 8531345 but I see that nothing has yet been done about it yet. The previous report was clear about the potential danger to passing pedestrians. We can see the tree clearly from our house (27 Greenfield Gardens) and it looks like an accident waiting to happen. The tree is leaning as well. It needs attention as a matter of some urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenfield Gardens, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Positive effects of dog poo bin removal, 13th December
item.description:
Behold Enfield Council‚Äôs latest triumph in urban planning: A sleek black cylinder, bravely stationed by the Wonder Pub, now bursting at the seams with a rich bouquet of dog waste, coffee cups, and the general aftermath of human optimism. Silence neigh-sayers, the council‚Äôs decision to remove dedicated poo bins in the local area is clearly a stroke of genius. Why have specialised infrastructure when you can encourage dog owners to play dog poo Jenga with already-full street bins? Nothing says ‚Äúwelcome to the neighbourhood‚Äù quite like warm dog mess fermenting next to bus stops, shops, restaurants and pubs. The artistic layering is particularly impressive: bags wedged into the rim, some valiantly clinging to the sides, others spilling gracefully onto the pavement like nature intended. It‚Äôs less ‚Äúlitter problem‚Äù and more ‚Äúinteractive public installation,‚Äù inviting passers-by to ponder life, responsibility, and which council meeting approved this masterpiece: presumably the same that approved the library mural in a conservation area. Bravo, Enfield Council: by removing poo bins, you‚Äôve not removed the poo you‚Äôve simply redistributed the experience. üëè

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Laurel Bank Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole cover is loose and noise, 13th December
item.description:
Swinton Street, in front of numbers 61, 63, and the Nuffield Centre Two weeks ago, a company performed asphalt work and manhole installation for the electrical system on Swinton Street. The work completed has several defects: the manhole cover is loose, and the asphalt surface is excessively raised and improperly leveled. This defective surface generates a prominent percussive noise as vehicles drive by my property. Additionally, the 20 mph speed restriction is frequently disregarded by drivers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61-65, Swinton Street, King's Cross, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yellow bin attracting dumping, 13th December
item.description:
There is a yellow bin that doesn‚Äôt belong to anyone and has been there for some time. It doesn‚Äôt have a lid and more frequently, this is attracting dumping of other people‚Äôs rubbish and furniture and anything else they desire in it. My own bin is now being used as a dumping ground and constantly being flagged for containing incorrect items that have nothing to do with me as were dumped there by other people. This is increasingly getting worse as the dumped items are getting more and more ambitious. Please can you have this bin removed as is becoming a constant nuisance resulting in constant littering of the surrounding areas. Foxes getting into the rubbish scattering litter in my garden, and I have now also seen evidence of mice. I am disabled and cannot keep experiencing this on a regular basis. I plead for you to remove this bin and its contents at the earliest to help put a stop to this disgusting behavior. Tonight was the absolute last straw when I returned from a break to rubbish scattered all over and my own bin not collected yet again because of rubbish left in there by other people and all sorts of items discarded there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Clarendon Green, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
